main event: An observer in Johnstown, Pennsylvania, reported seeing a bright light that appeared to be following a satellite on the night of September 16, 1967.
interesting points: The light seemed to lock onto the satellite as it ascended in the sky., The observer described the light as the brightest in the sky that night., The light dimmed to the brightness of other stars before disappearing., The observer had a cousin who witnessed the event alongside them., The report was classified as 'Insufficient Data for Evaluation' due to the time elapsed since the sighting.
sighted object: a bright light in the sky
witness description: 10th-grade students, specifically a student and a cousin
